comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Judge Owen Pierce Thompson of Jacksonville, Illinois. "Judge Owen P. Thompson of Jacksonville, Ill., announced this afternoon that in a letter dated July 17, William J. Bryan asked that he call upon Roger Sullivan with a message from Mr. Bryan requesting that Sullivan, in the interest of harmony, at once resign as National Committeeman from Illinois." Source: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9505E3DE1F3EE733A... I started a Wikipedia entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Owen_Pierce_Thompson Henry Thomas Rainey (August 20, 1860–August 19, 1934) was a prominent U.S. politician during the first third of the 20th century. He served in the United States House of Representatives from 1903 to 1921 and from 1923 to his death as a Democrat from Illinois, and was its Speaker during the famous Hundred days of Franklin D. Roosevelt in 1933. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Thomas_Rainey
